title: Hot Questions - Stack Exchange
description: We make Stack Overflow and 170+ other community-powered Q&A sites.

h2:
How did the ancient cultures determine that the year was actually a fraction of an extra day beyond 365 days?
                


                    If microwave ovens run at 2.4 GHz, what is the long-term effect on living tissue of exposure to this frequency, but with a thousand times less energy?
                


                    Why did XML lose out to XHTML, then HTML 5, on the web?
                


                    Value of describing game mechanics in a data file instead of hardcoding?
                


                    Horror/Monster movie shown on TV in Basic Instinct
                


                    How does one research (pure) mathematics in a more inclusive manner?
                


                    Making an exoskeleton for combat
                


                    What is special about the Poisson/Binomial distributions such that they have special regression estimation techniques?
                


                    Is it idiomatic to say "I have to race with time" to mean I have to do a thing very fast and finish it before something bad might happen?
                


                    Redshift of CMB
                


                    Passionate about research in general but open to many fields: is academia for me?
                


                    Does damage taken from Warding Bond count as magical?
                


                    How would I make text bend (as if it's being folded) but not on an isometric grid?
                


                    Is there a true 1 dimensional object?
                


                    Inner voice when reading mathematics
                


                    What idiom could describe bureaucratic inefficiency?
                


                    Having a second bite of the data-apple without p-hacking
                


                    HST can apparently operate in one-gyro mode, if need be. Why was the Compton Gamma Ray Observatory de-orbited when it lost one of its three gyros?
                


                    Why doesn't b = a; f[a_] := b; f[2] return 2?
                


                    Movie where three people get locked in a hotel
                


                    Why is COALESCE not a function?
                


                    How does ls know how to output its results?
                


                    Can a district attorney dismiss their own traffic ticket?
                


                    Should I be worried about unusual SSH login attempts from unknown IP addresses?
                


                    Why is sampling frequency/rate typically abbreviated Fs and not Sf in English?
                


                    Why doesn't Singapore stamp passports?
                


                    Can a pilot tell a controller they don't need IFR clearance?
                


                    Groups whose derived length is logarithmic in the order?
                


                    Is an explanation for consciousness even possible? If not, what are we searching for?
                


                    In a nested multicols environment, how to only set the most inner one has separation ruler?
h3: Stack Exchange Q&A communities are different. Here's how:
a: How did the ancient cultures determine that the year was actually a fraction of an extra day beyond 365 days?
If microwave ovens run at 2.4 GHz, what is the long-term effect on living tissue of exposure to this frequency, but with a thousand times less energy?
Why did XML lose out to XHTML, then HTML 5, on the web?
Value of describing game mechanics in a data file instead of hardcoding?
Horror/Monster movie shown on TV in Basic Instinct
How does one research (pure) mathematics in a more inclusive manner?
What is special about the Poisson/Binomial distributions such that they have special regression estimation techniques?
Is it idiomatic to say "I have to race with time" to mean I have to do a thing very fast and finish it before something bad might happen?
Passionate about research in general but open to many fields: is academia for me?
Does damage taken from Warding Bond count as magical?
How would I make text bend (as if it's being folded) but not on an isometric grid?
Is there a true 1 dimensional object?
What idiom could describe bureaucratic inefficiency?
Having a second bite of the data-apple without p-hacking
HST can apparently operate in one-gyro mode, if need be. Why was the Compton Gamma Ray Observatory de-orbited when it lost one of its three gyros?
Why doesn't b = a; f[a_] := b; f[2] return 2?
Movie where three people get locked in a hotel
Why is COALESCE not a function?
How does ls know how to output its results?
Can a district attorney dismiss their own traffic ticket?
Should I be worried about unusual SSH login attempts from unknown IP addresses?
Why is sampling frequency/rate typically abbreviated Fs and not Sf in English?
Can a pilot tell a controller they don't need IFR clearance?
Groups whose derived length is logarithmic in the order?
Is an explanation for consciousness even possible? If not, what are we searching for?
In a nested multicols environment, how to only set the most inner one has separation ruler?

Stack Exchange Q&A communities are different. Here's how:





Expert communities.
                    Each of our 182 
                    communities is built by people passionate about a focused topic.
                




The right answer. Right on top.
                    Experts like you can vote on posts, so the most helpful answers are easy to find.
                




Share knowledge. Earn trust.
                    Earn reputation and additional privileges for posts others find helpful.
